timeline.bodyText: What was the significance (if any) of the "if (evt.getNewValue() == null)" check in the original code?
timeline.author: esaunders

replies.bodyText: When you see if "(evt.getNewValue() == null)" when handling a CURRENT_CASE event it is being done to determine whether the current case changed because a case was opened or closed by looking for which property has a reference to a case.
replies.author: rcordovano

replies.bodyText: Ok, does that mean that the check should not have been removed in the new code then?
replies.author: esaunders

replies.bodyText: Looking at TimeLineModule.getController() it appears that if the controller is null, a new controller is fetched based on the open case.  It seems to me that this should occur if a case is closed or if a different case is opened.  Was this an incorrect assumption?
replies.author: gdicristofaro

timeline.message: revision based on bugs found in timeline
